title: Filtering a timetable by sessions fails after resetting the filter on IE9
body:
The dropdown menu doesn't show up. Steps to reproduce the bug on this [event](https://indico.cern.ch/event/342240/timetable/#20141007.detailed):
- Filter (about on top right)
- Sessions (at bottom of page) -> Deselect all, but not Introduction. (this works OK)
- Click outside to get rid of the little window.
- Reset Filter (works OK)
- Click again on Sessions button. It does not show up the window to select sessions anymore!
- Only a reload of the page makes it work again.

title: FinalDropDown is not usable on iOS
body:
**Describe the bug**
The FinalDropDown element is not usable on iOS as when clicking it the system "zooms in" and the dropdown moves out of position.

**To Reproduce**
1. use an iOS device (I'm using an iPhone 15 Pro Max)
2. use a form containing one or more FinalDropDown
3. click in a FinalDropDown
4. try to select a value

**Expected behavior**
The values are visible and selectable

**Screenshots**
First test with Chrome:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f2c7c023-44dc-4382-8086-5ca62fc30eea)

Second test with Safari:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0446c39b-5c96-438c-b6de-ea6651e71484)

**Additional context**
Demo: https://sandbox.getindico.io/event/4757/

title: Adding many authors (~30) in abstract submission makes reordering extremely slow
body:
**Describe the bug**

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to an abstract submission page
2. Add around 30 authors
3. Try to move a single author up or down the list

**Expected behavior**

Authors just reorders

**What happens instead**

Dragging the author works until you release your mouse upon which the page slows down so much that firefox shows the following warning

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13602468/132982313-37a9b004-39a1-4b3a-89ba-9e90863cbbec.png)


**Additional context**

Firefox 78.0.2 (64-bit)

# Ticket imported from Trac

I beleive that the term "Default convenors" in https://www.cta-observatory.org/indico/sessionModification.py?sessionId=17&confId=114 (please check with a random InDiCo installation on a random **Conference** event - I did not find the right place in the sources.) is not correct.
The function that is attributed to the person(s) entered in that form is the "session convenor" and eventually the "session coordinator". By default, he will be the convenor of the session (yep!), but the term "Default convenor" is misleading.

title: In 3-step booking, choice of days is not limited
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

When using the 3-step booking process, one can successfully pick any future day for a reservation, regardless of the "maximum days in advance" setting.
The result is a (super ugly) error message containing an error report.

One solution would be to show the "bars" of rooms that are not "bookable" for a specific day already in red (or another explanatory color) in the availability view (with an informative tooltip).

title: Registration field "choice" resets input type on edit
body:
When editing a "Choice" field in a registration form, the "input type" always resets to "drop down", even if it was previously "radio group"

**To Reproduce**
1. Add a Choice field in a registration form
2. Set the input type to "radio group" and save
3. Now edit with "configure field"
4. The "input type" will be reset to "drop down" if other changes are saved

**Expected behavior**
Editing a Choice field should not change the input type, unless this is explicitly switched by the user

**Context**
Behaviour observed with the current production Indico at CERN, `v3.1.1-pre`

title: category search results list contains categories that have been previously deleted
body:
**Bug Description**
when I search for category (i.e. I'm moving an event to another category) and I type a category name, I get in the result set all the occurrences of that category even if it has been removed (once or many times).
As shown here:
![category_search](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5447192/145198908-20d8aa24-fd01-4fc4-8c1e-8bffe6256fcc.png)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a conference page
2. Click on "Event action" and then "Move"
3. "Select a category" will appear
4. Type a category that has been deleted from the system, once or more times
5. In the results list you will get a row the category for every time it has been created (and deleted)  

**Expected behavior**
Category search results should not include categories that have been removed by the system

title: contributions get shown multiple times if event timezone and display timezone cause day breaks within session
body:
When looking at the [all-days detailed agenda of acat 2017](https://indico.cern.ch/event/567550/timetable/#all.detailed) and set the display timezone to CEST, those contributions which are on the second last day in CEST and the local time zone (i.e. the first contributions on thursday, which still take place on european thursday) get displayed twice - a second time at late european friday. see this [screen cast](http://pseyfert.web.cern.ch/pseyfert/ACAT_daybreak.mp4.webm).
Those contributions get shown only once when picking the local timezone as display timezone.

title: [A11Y] Status messages are not announced in the search app
body:
**Describe the bug**

When searching, status messages (e.g., "No result") are not announced by the screen reader.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the search page with screen reader turned on
2. Type a bogus keyword into the search field
3. Observe that the "No result" message is shown but screen reader does not announce it

**Expected behavior**

Screen reader announces the status messages.

**Additional context**

- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/status-messages.html
- https://talk.getindico.io/t/status-message-search-app-live-notices/3274

title: Multi-select of participants not possible (any more)
body:
**Describe the bug**
https://indico.cta-observatory.org/event/*/manage/registration/*/registrations/ does not allow to add multiple users from the "favourites" list in the "add Indico user" dialogue (started from Register::IndicoUser dropdown menu).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://indico.cta-observatory.org/event/*/manage/registration/*/registrations of your favourite test event (after activating participant registration eventually).
2. Click on 'Register', then 'Indico User`
3. Click on one user in the list of favourite users. 
4. Try to add a second (and third), e.g. by Ctrl-click
5. The first selected user is unselected. This did not happen before.

**Expected behavior**
This did not happen in Indico 1 and before, probably I also used in earlier Indico 2 version, I do not remember exactly.
I see no reason to remove the multi-select feature. Or did I miss how it works now (not Ctrl-click anyway)?

title: Save button not enabled when adding a room in a location

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**
In the room booking system, add a room in a location.  In the "Add Room" dialog there are some fields marked with red asterisk which is required.  However the save button would not be enabled even all the fields were filled.  I also *need to* fill both "Longitude" and "Latitude" then the save button will be enabled, and will keep enabled even I remove the value in Longitude and Latitude.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Room booking system
2. Click on 'Administration'
3. Click on a pre-defined location and click "Add room"
4. In the "Add Room" dialog the save button is disabled until I fill both Longitude and Latitude


**Expected behavior**
I should be able to save the room without filling the Longitude and Latitude

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/179599/67635434-8f6d5c00-f8c7-11e9-9eec-84e52ada30c6.png)

title: Failed login message: Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen: [error]
body:
Using Indico 3.2.2, if providing incorrect credentials, and trying to log in using LDAP, the error is:

    Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen: [error]

In the log it says:

    2022-08-25 09:36:35,370  WARNING  37654e7b0fa34280  -       indico.auth               Invalid credentials (ip=X, provider=ldap): No such user

or

    2022-08-25 09:32:35,228  WARNING  4aeb1fe5702a46ef  -       indico.auth               Invalid credentials (ip=X, provider=ldap): Invalid credentials

Could that string be used instead? (No idea, if it should be generalized to not allow somebody to check for valid user names.)

title: Don't lose all input after a HTML security error in PR assessment comments
body:
When commenting on a Paper (Paper Reviewing => Assess content) using disallowed HTML tags in the comment results in a HTML security error. This is the correct behavior, but it currently clears the textarea, so the whole comment is lost even though it would be easy for the user to fix the actual issue.
- [x] Preserve the entered text in case of an error so the user can correct it.
- [ ] If we do not render the comments as HTML anywhere, we could disable the HTML security check for them - it doesn't make much sense to do this for plaintext data.

Hi, 

We trying to use places left feature for the first time with 0.99, as we thought it works now. But as far as we start to define the places we observed unpredicted behavior. We have a group of sessions as radio buttons with one choice for one day e.g. Wednesday. Once the group is setup it looks like it works, but if I add another one radio button with say 15 places left, the "places left" for other buttons changes unpredictably, if it were 20 then it turns to 11 for some reason etc. So I tried to understand the logic of bug behind, but didn't succeed. It is even hard to explain it as I sometimes it looks random, sometimes follow some pattern e.g. shift all numbers to 10. The easiest thing to show is the number of "places left" differ on event page to what I see in the admin mode: 

on registration page you could check: 

e.g. 

 Combining Grid and Cloud for e-sciences applications    [19 place(s) left]

 Effective Analysis Programming 2  
 [20 place(s) left]

 Globus Technology Workshop 
 [15 place(s) left]

 Multi-threaded Programming 
 [18 place(s) left]

 Training Session on Openstack 1  
 [15 place(s) left]

or on original page: 
http://indico.scc.kit.edu/indico/confRegistrationFormDisplay.py/display?confId=26

and in admin mode: 

Combining Grid and Cloud for e-sciences applications (29 places)  
Effective Analysis Programming 2 (30 places)  
Globus Technology Workshop (25 places)  
Multi-threaded Programming (28 places)  
Training Session on Openstack 1 (26 places) 
no session

I have to apply shift 10 here to get the correct number ( the actual number of places we have) on event page, say to get 20 on event page  I set 30 in admin mode etc. I hope someone could give some hints for this problem. Thank you. 

Cheers, 

Pavel 
## 

Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT)
Steinbuch Centre for Computing (SCC)

Dr. Pavel Weber

title: Client-side validation for time input field (Safari)
body:
The time input field [doesn't work well on Safari](http://caniuse.com/#feat=input-pattern), since it allows free text and it's not restricted to a pair of digits.
This creates problems as people may enter whatever they want, leading to error reports.
We need to check if there is an easy way to implement a client-side validation for the time input field [1]. Server-side validation would lead to loss of data when the form is submitted.

[1]: Maybe `patternMismatch` can help: http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/forms/constraintvalidation/

This could 100% just be my setup but when editing and viewing document templates in Firefox, some of the text is not visible and does not consistently appear. Changing the colours gets some text to appear but does not work as expected. This happens when using the default Receipt template with v3.3.1 for both the editor and viewing the pdf. title: Reservations in the future can't be modified to an earlier date
body:
When trying to modify a reservation, users can't select a day prior to the day the reservation was initially created for because the days in the calendar appear grayed out.

This is what happens:

```
Today |----------- invalid dates -----------| Reservation |------------ valid dates
19 Jan                                          12 Feb
```

This is what should happen:

```
Today |------------ valid dates ------------| Reservation |------------ valid dates
19 Jan                                          12 Feb
```

title: Translation error in German roombooking error message when trying to book an already booked timeslot
body:
**Describe the bug**
See issue title, not much else to say about it.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Select a room (e.g. from the bookings overview)
2. Start a booking and select a timeslot which is already booked
3. An error message is displayed: "Raum kann nicht reserviert werden. Der Raum ist in dem/den ausgewählten Zeitfenster(n) frei"

**Expected behavior**
The second sentence of the translation seems to be missing a "nicht" or other negation to indicate that the room is in fact not free to book at the selected timeslot.
(The English error message is: "Space cannot be booked. One or more bookings would conflict with yours.")

title: Do not let people select rooms they can't book

milestone.title: v1.1
milestone.description:
* Indico mobile
* Room booking new face
* Many UX improvements

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

In the new Room Booking interface,  one is shown a row per room with a green bar representing "bookable" times. However, it can happen that you click on a bar and get a page saying "You are not authorized to book this room", as you are not member of the group that can book this room. This should not happen.

There are two options:
- When a user clicks a "green bar", do an AJAX call that checks if (s)he can book that room, and only forward him/her to the booking page in case (s)he's got permission. Otherwise, show a message stating which group has access.
- Do not even show that room as bookable from the beginning. Display the bar in a different color or something like that (probably slower?).

title: Problem reusing Vidyo Room (attach room)

milestone.title: v1.2
milestone.description:
* Refactor authentication system
* Offline website creation
* Migrated to Flask framework
* New URL schema
* Many UX improvements

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

[From ARP]:

Problem:
1. We have the meeting A, with the Vidyo room called "Vidyo_A" and a PIN "1111".
2. We create the meeting B, and we try to create a Vidyo room "Vidyo_A" with a PIN "2222".
3. It will show up a popup to attach the existing meeting and you accept.
4. The new "booking" shows that the PIN is "2222" when is actually "1111"
5. If you click in refresh it will be updated to "1111" because it is the real one.

Solution:

Do not accept "2222", maintain the values as they were in the old meeting, but in the popup give a more detailed explanation, and fix the bug that shows 2222 after that.

title: "Convener" tag name not localizable
body:
**Describe the bug**
The reviewing area shows labels "Reviewer" and "Convener" where appropriate for a given user, so it's clear who can handle what in which track. For some reason, the string "Convener" is not localizable via Transifex - search for it returns nothing.
"Reviewer" is there just fine.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a conference with tracks
2. Try to assign roles to the users using the Roles in abstract submission setup
3. Switch to some other localization, like Turkish
4. See the "Convener" string stand out in the page.

**Expected behavior**
"Convener" string should be localizable.

title: Access rights mismatch - people with rights for "Registrations" see Payments tab, but get Access denied
body:
**Describe the bug**
I have a conference with Manual and Bank transfer payment modules enabled.
A person has been granted Access and Registration rights using the Protection/Event protection tabs.
Now, she can enter the Management area and sees two tabs - Payments and Registrations.
But clicking on the Payments tab yields "You are not authorised to manage this event.".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Make a conference
2. Enable payments, manual payment and Bank transfer module
3. Make a registration form that results in money to be wired
3. Add a person from accounting department with rights for Registration and explain her that she will handle registration payments.
4. Let the user login and go to the management area.
5. Let the user click Payments
6. Run, Forest, run! Because the "You are not authorised" error will be displayed and the person will get confused.

**Expected behavior**
The payments tab should not be visible if the person has no right to access it.

A user profile has one, multi line, test area where the user can enter their address.

City

body:
**Describe the bug**

**To Reproduce**

1. Create subcontribution with description
3. Open relevant URL as above

Description is shown

title: Relative dates in "News" section on start page broken in German translation
body:
**Describe the bug**
A picture says more than 1000 words:
![Indico_German_Date](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/166759/b4f7dfb3-561c-4538-80bf-576a52173af1)

It seems the relative date is formatted wrongly, i.e. it reads:
` Veröffentlicht am “53tMESZt3r” Mittwoch `
instead of:
` Veröffentlicht am letzten Mittwoch `

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add a news message for which a relative date will be used, e.g. within the last week. 
2. Use timezone `Europe/Berlin`. 
3. Visit Indico start page and select German language. 

**Additional Information**
Using a different timezone, e.g. UTC, yields:
` Veröffentlicht am “53tUTCt3r” Mittwoch `

Switching to English shows:
` Posted Last Wednesday `
as expected.

body:

Please help solve this issue for us.

Thanks and regards,
Janos BODOR

When grouped by Event Start Date, Indico is trying to parse the startDate param of each booking whereas, for this index, the bookings do not have a concept of their associated event (except EVO it seems) and, therefore, was attempting a parsing of a subset of an empty string.

Other indexes are fine as they refer to the times of modification or creation of the bookings themselves, not the events to which they are linked.

title: Invalid URL when booking a room for a multi-days event

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**

When trying to book a room for multi-days event ('Book' on the Event in Room Booking in Event management), the URL created is for a daily booking from the first day to the last day of the meeting, from the time of the start of the meeting to the time of the end of the meeting.
This work well if the meeting starts and ends every day at the same time, but for a meeting which starts one day after lunch and ends on a following day before lunch the time selected has it's end before its start...

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an event starting on day X at 13:30 and ending at day X+n at 12:30
2. Click on 'Room Booking'
3. Click 'Book'
4. See error: `Something went wrong The provided URL was not properly formatted.`

**Expected behavior**
Well, the correct behavior is difficult to define, as the timeslots of the room booking for daily booking don't really match the event boundaries. At least I'm expecting not to get an error.
A solution could be to give the option to give links to book days independently if they don't start/end at the same time?

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```
- The JavaScript validation allows weekly repetitions even if the booking lasts only six days (or 13 days for biweekly), e.g.: 25.05. until 31.05. is valid for a weekly repetition. However, the first repetition would be on 01.06.
- In such a case - or actually any case where the end date of the booking does not exactly hit an occurence - another occurence happens even though it's after the booking end date. Example: Booking 25/05/2011 — 09/06/2011, biweekly repetition, occurences are: 25/05/2011, 08/06/2011, 22/06/2011.
